title: Pulitzer Prize
description: Pulitzer Prize for Fiction and General Nonfiction winners and finalists (2010-2025)

entries.title: James
entries.author: Percival Everett
entries.description: A reimagining of Adventures of Huckleberry Finn told from the perspective of the enslaved man Jim, exploring the absurdity of racial supremacy and the search for family and freedom.

entries.title: Headshot
entries.author: Rita Bullwinkel
entries.description: A novel following eight teenage girls competing in a boxing tournament in Reno, Nevada, exploring violence, ambition, and female power.

entries.title: Mice 1961
entries.author: Stacey Levine
entries.description: An experimental novel set in a small Washington State town where peculiar events unfold among ordinary residents.

entries.title: The Unicorn Woman
entries.author: Gayl Jones
entries.description: A novel exploring race, identity, and mythology through the story of a Black woman in America.

entries.title: To the Success of Our Hopeless Cause: The Many Lives of the Soviet Dissident Movement
entries.author: Benjamin Nathans
entries.description: A chronicle of how an improbable band of Soviet dissidents demanded the Kremlin obey its own laws, ultimately undermining the Soviet system.

entries.title: I Am on the Hit List: A Journalist's Murder and the Rise of Autocracy in India
entries.author: Rollo Romig
entries.description: An investigation into the assassination of Indian journalist Gauri Lankesh and the rise of Hindu nationalism.

entries.title: Until I Find You: Disappeared Children and Coercive Adoptions in Guatemala
entries.author: Rachel Nolan
entries.description: A deeply researched account of Guatemala's adoption industry and the families torn apart by coercive practices.

entries.title: Night Watch
entries.author: Jayne Anne Phillips
entries.description: A haunting Civil War-era story centered on a mother and daughter grappling with trauma and survival in a West Virginia asylum.

entries.title: Same Bed Different Dreams
entries.author: Ed Park
entries.description: A genre-bending novel interweaving Korean history, a secret society, and a Silicon Valley tech company.

entries.title: Wednesday's Child
entries.author: Yiyun Li
entries.description: A novel exploring grief, motherhood, and the complexities of Chinese-American identity.

entries.title: A Day in the Life of Abed Salama: Anatomy of a Jerusalem Tragedy
entries.author: Nathan Thrall
entries.description: A devastating account of a school bus accident that reveals the profound inequalities of life under Israeli occupation.

entries.title: Cobalt Red: How the Blood of the Congo Powers Our Lives
entries.author: Siddharth Kara
entries.description: An expose of the human toll of cobalt mining in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, which supplies most of the world's cobalt for electronics.

entries.title: Fire Weather: A True Story from a Hotter World
entries.author: John Vaillant
entries.description: An account of the 2016 Fort McMurray wildfire in Canada that destroyed the hub of Canada's oil industry and displaced 88,000 people.

entries.title: Demon Copperhead
entries.author: Barbara Kingsolver
entries.description: A modern retelling of David Copperfield set in Appalachian Virginia, exploring the opioid crisis through a boy's coming-of-age story.

entries.title: Trust
entries.author: Hernan Diaz
entries.description: A puzzle-box narrative examining wealth, power, and the nature of storytelling through four interconnected accounts set in Gilded Age New York.

entries.title: The Immortal King Rao
entries.author: Vauhini Vara
entries.description: In an advanced tech society, Athena carries her father's memories and desires to join a tech-free resistance movement.

entries.title: His Name Is George Floyd: One Man's Life and the Struggle for Racial Justice
entries.author: Robert Samuels and Toluse Olorunnipa
entries.description: A comprehensive biography of George Floyd that traces his life from Houston's Third Ward to his murder in Minneapolis.

entries.title: Kingdom of Characters: The Language Revolution That Made China Modern
entries.author: Jing Tsu
entries.description: The story of how China modernized its language system and fought to preserve Chinese characters in the digital age.

entries.title: Sounds Wild and Broken: Sonic Marvels, Evolution's Creativity, and the Crisis of Sensory Extinction
entries.author: David George Haskell
entries.description: An exploration of how sound evolved on Earth and the threats facing the planet's acoustic diversity.

entries.title: Under the Skin: The Hidden Toll of Racism on American Lives and on the Health of Our Nation
entries.author: Linda Villarosa
entries.description: An investigation into how racism in American medicine has led to devastating health disparities for Black Americans.

entries.title: The Netanyahus
entries.author: Joshua Cohen
entries.description: A darkly comic historical novel about a Jewish historian's chaotic encounter with the Netanyahu family at a 1960s American college.

entries.title: Monkey Boy
entries.author: Francisco Goldman
entries.description: A semi-autobiographical novel about a writer returning to Boston to confront his traumatic childhood and family secrets.

entries.title: Palmares
entries.author: Gayl Jones
entries.description: An epic novel following an enslaved woman in 17th-century Brazil and her quest for freedom in the legendary settlement of Palmares.

entries.title: Invisible Child: Poverty, Survival & Hope in an American City
entries.author: Andrea Elliott
entries.description: An eight-year investigation following a homeless girl named Dasani through the New York City shelter system.

entries.title: Home, Land, Security: Deradicalization and the Journey Back from Extremism
entries.author: Carla Power
entries.description: An exploration of how former extremists from around the world have been deradicalized and reintegrated into society.

entries.title: The Family Roe: An American Story
entries.author: Joshua Prager
entries.description: A comprehensive biography of Norma McCorvey, the plaintiff known as Jane Roe, and the legacy of Roe v. Wade.

entries.title: The Night Watchman
entries.author: Louise Erdrich
entries.description: Based on Erdrich's grandfather's fight against Native American dispossession and termination policy in 1950s North Dakota.

entries.title: A Registry of My Passage Upon the Earth
entries.author: Daniel Mason
entries.description: A collection of interconnected stories spanning centuries and continents, exploring the nature of storytelling itself.

entries.title: Telephone
entries.author: Percival Everett
entries.description: A novel about a geologist whose daughter falls ill with a mysterious disease, leading him on a journey to find answers.

entries.title: Wilmington's Lie: The Murderous Coup of 1898 and the Rise of White Supremacy
entries.author: David Zucchino
entries.description: A gripping account of the violent overthrow of the elected government of a Black-majority North Carolina city after Reconstruction.

entries.title: Minor Feelings: An Asian American Reckoning
entries.author: Cathy Park Hong
entries.description: A collection of essays exploring Asian American identity, art, and the psychology of racial consciousness in America.

entries.title: Yellow Bird: Oil, Murder, and a Woman's Search for Justice in Indian Country
entries.author: Sierra Crane Murdoch
entries.description: The true story of an Arikara woman's obsessive investigation into a murder on the Fort Berthold Indian Reservation.

entries.title: The Nickel Boys
entries.author: Colson Whitehead
entries.description: The story of two boys at a brutal reform school in Jim Crow-era Florida, inspired by the true story of the Dozier School.

entries.title: The Dutch House
entries.author: Ann Patchett
entries.description: A family saga spanning five decades about a brother and sister bound by their childhood home and the stepmother who banished them.

entries.title: The Topeka School
entries.author: Ben Lerner
entries.description: A novel set in 1990s Kansas exploring masculinity, rhetoric, and the roots of contemporary American dysfunction.

entries.title: The Undying: Pain, Vulnerability, Mortality, Medicine, Art, Time, Dreams, Data, Exhaustion, Cancer, and Care
entries.author: Anne Boyer
entries.description: A memoir and meditation on cancer, mortality, and the failures of the American healthcare system.

entries.title: Solitary: Unbroken by Four Decades in Solitary Confinement
entries.author: Albert Woodfox
entries.description: An unflinching memoir of wrongful conviction and 44 years in solitary confinement at Louisiana's Angola prison.

entries.title: Elderhood: Redefining Aging, Transforming Medicine, Reimagining Life
entries.author: Louise Aronson
entries.description: A geriatrician's empathetic critique of how society and healthcare mistreat the elderly.

entries.title: The Overstory
entries.author: Richard Powers
entries.description: An epic novel weaving together nine Americans whose lives are shaped by trees and environmental activism.

entries.title: The Great Believers
entries.author: Rebecca Makkai
entries.description: A dual narrative exploring the AIDS crisis in 1980s Chicago and its lasting effects decades later in Paris.

entries.title: There There
entries.author: Tommy Orange
entries.description: A multi-voiced novel following twelve urban Native Americans converging on a powwow in Oakland, California.

entries.title: Amity and Prosperity: One Family and the Fracturing of America
entries.author: Eliza Griswold
entries.description: A chronicle of an Appalachian family's struggle against corporate oil fracking and the destruction it wreaks on their community.

entries.title: In a Day's Work: The Fight to End Sexual Violence Against America's Most Vulnerable Workers
entries.author: Bernice Yeung
entries.description: An investigation into sexual assault against low-wage immigrant women workers and their fight for justice.

entries.title: Rising: Dispatches from the New American Shore
entries.author: Elizabeth Rush
entries.description: A firsthand account of communities across America threatened by rising seas and climate change.

entries.title: Less
entries.author: Andrew Sean Greer
entries.description: A comic novel following a struggling novelist who travels the world to avoid his ex-boyfriend's wedding while confronting aging and love.

entries.title: In the Distance
entries.author: Hernan Diaz
entries.description: A Swedish immigrant's odyssey across 19th-century America, traveling from coast to coast the wrong way.

entries.title: The Idiot
entries.author: Elif Batuman
entries.description: A young woman's first year at Harvard in the 1990s, navigating email, intellectual life, and unrequited love.

entries.title: Locking Up Our Own: Crime and Punishment in Black America
entries.author: James Forman Jr.
entries.description: An examination of how Black communities contributed to mass incarceration while fighting for public safety.

entries.title: Notes on a Foreign Country: An American Abroad in a Post-American World
entries.author: Suzy Hansen
entries.description: An American journalist's reckoning with her country's foreign policy while living in Istanbul.

entries.title: The Evolution of Beauty: How Darwin's Forgotten Theory of Mate Choice Shapes the Animal World - and Us
entries.author: Richard O. Prum
entries.description: An ornithologist's argument for the role of aesthetic evolution in shaping animal and human beauty.

entries.title: The Underground Railroad
entries.author: Colson Whitehead
entries.description: A reimagining of American slavery where the Underground Railroad is a literal railway beneath the Southern soil.

entries.title: Imagine Me Gone
entries.author: Adam Haslett
entries.description: A novel about a family haunted by mental illness across generations, exploring love, loyalty, and loss.

entries.title: The Sport of Kings
entries.author: C. E. Morgan
entries.description: An epic saga of race, class, and horse breeding in Kentucky spanning generations.

entries.title: Evicted: Poverty and Profit in the American City
entries.author: Matthew Desmond
entries.description: An expose of the American housing crisis following eight families in Milwaukee facing eviction.

entries.title: Strangers in Their Own Land: Anger and Mourning on the American Right
entries.author: Arlie Russell Hochschild
entries.description: A sociologist's empathetic exploration of Tea Party supporters in Louisiana's petrochemical corridor.

entries.title: In a Different Key: The Story of Autism
entries.author: John Donvan and Caren Zucker
entries.description: A comprehensive history of autism from its first diagnosis to the present day.

entries.title: The Sympathizer
entries.author: Viet Thanh Nguyen
entries.description: A spy thriller about a communist double agent in the final days of the Vietnam War and its aftermath in America.

entries.title: Get in Trouble
entries.author: Kelly Link
entries.description: A collection of fantastical short stories blending horror, fairy tale, and science fiction.

entries.title: Maud's Line
entries.author: Margaret Verble
entries.description: A novel set in 1920s Oklahoma Indian Territory about a Cherokee woman torn between tradition and change.

entries.title: Black Flags: The Rise of ISIS
entries.author: Joby Warrick
entries.description: An account of how Abu Musab al-Zarqawi's extremism and U.S. policy failures led to the rise of ISIS.

entries.title: Between the World and Me
entries.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
entries.description: A letter to the author's teenage son about the history and reality of being Black in America.

entries.title: Ordinary Light
entries.author: Tracy K. Smith
entries.description: A memoir about the author's childhood in California and her relationship with her mother.

entries.title: All the Light We Cannot See
entries.author: Anthony Doerr
entries.description: A blind French girl and a German boy whose paths collide in occupied France during World War II.

entries.title: The Moor's Account
entries.author: Laila Lalami
entries.description: A fictional memoir of the first Black explorer of America, an enslaved Moroccan man in 16th-century Florida.

entries.title: Let Me Be Frank with You
entries.author: Richard Ford
entries.description: Four linked stories continuing the saga of Frank Bascombe as he navigates life in post-Hurricane Sandy New Jersey.

entries.title: The Sixth Extinction: An Unnatural History
entries.author: Elizabeth Kolbert
entries.description: An investigation into the man-made mass extinction currently threatening Earth's biodiversity.

entries.title: Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth, and Faith in the New China
entries.author: Evan Osnos
entries.description: A portrait of contemporary China through the stories of ordinary people seeking prosperity and meaning.

entries.title: No Good Men Among the Living: America, the Taliban, and the War Through Afghan Eyes
entries.author: Anand Gopal
entries.description: An account of the Afghanistan war told through three Afghans caught between American forces and the Taliban.

entries.title: The Goldfinch
entries.author: Donna Tartt
entries.description: A young man's life transformed after surviving a terrorist bombing at an art museum, centered on a stolen painting.

entries.title: The Son
entries.author: Philipp Meyer
entries.description: An epic multigenerational saga of a Texas family spanning 150 years of American expansion.

entries.title: The Woman Who Lost Her Soul
entries.author: Bob Shacochis
entries.description: A sprawling novel about an American woman whose death in Haiti leads to revelations about Cold War espionage.

entries.title: Toms River: A Story of Science and Salvation
entries.author: Dan Fagin
entries.description: An investigation into a New Jersey seashore town's cluster of childhood cancers linked to industrial pollution.

entries.title: The Blood Telegram: Nixon, Kissinger, and a Forgotten Genocide
entries.author: Gary J. Bass
entries.description: An account of how Nixon and Kissinger supported Pakistan during the 1971 genocide in Bangladesh.

entries.title: The Insurgents: David Petraeus and the Plot to Change the American Way of War
entries.author: Fred Kaplan
entries.description: The story of how a small group of military officers transformed American counterinsurgency strategy.

entries.title: The Orphan Master's Son
entries.author: Adam Johnson
entries.description: A sweeping epic set in North Korea following a man who takes on the identity of a high-ranking official.

entries.title: What We Talk About When We Talk About Anne Frank
entries.author: Nathan Englander
entries.description: A collection of stories exploring Jewish identity, faith, and the legacy of the Holocaust.

entries.title: The Snow Child
entries.author: Eowyn Ivey
entries.description: A magical realist novel set in 1920s Alaska about a childless couple who build a snow girl that comes to life.

entries.title: Devil in the Grove: Thurgood Marshall, the Groveland Boys, and the Dawn of a New America
entries.author: Gilbert King
entries.description: A chronicle of racial injustice in 1949 Florida where four Black men were falsely accused of rape.

entries.title: Behind the Beautiful Forevers: Life, Death, and Hope in a Mumbai Undercity
entries.author: Katherine Boo
entries.description: A portrait of life in a Mumbai slum as residents struggle to survive and rise amid corruption and poverty.

entries.title: The Passage of Power: The Years of Lyndon Johnson
entries.author: Robert A. Caro
entries.description: The fourth volume of Caro's LBJ biography, covering Kennedy's assassination and Johnson's ascent to power.

entries.title: No Award
entries.author: N/A
entries.description: The Pulitzer board declined to award a prize for fiction in 2012, despite three nominated finalists.

entries.title: Swamplandia!
entries.author: Karen Russell
entries.description: A novel about a family of alligator wrestlers in the Florida Everglades whose tourist attraction is failing.

entries.title: The Pale King
entries.author: David Foster Wallace
entries.description: Wallace's unfinished posthumous novel about IRS employees in Illinois confronting boredom and meaning.

entries.title: Train Dreams
entries.author: Denis Johnson
entries.description: A novella following a day laborer in the early 20th-century American West who loses everything to a forest fire.

entries.title: The Swerve: How the World Became Modern
entries.author: Stephen Greenblatt
entries.description: The story of how a 15th-century book hunter's discovery of an ancient Roman poem helped launch the Renaissance.

entries.title: One Hundred Names for Love: A Stroke, a Marriage, and the Language of Healing
entries.author: Diane Ackerman
entries.description: A memoir about caring for the author's husband after a stroke destroyed his ability to use language.

entries.title: Unnatural Selection: Choosing Boys over Girls, and the Consequences of a World Full of Men
entries.author: Mara Hvistendahl
entries.description: An investigation into sex-selective abortion and its demographic consequences across Asia.

entries.title: A Visit from the Goon Squad
entries.author: Jennifer Egan
entries.description: An innovative, interconnected story about aging punk rockers and the passage of time in the digital age.

entries.title: The Privileges
entries.author: Jonathan Dee
entries.description: A novel following a wealthy Manhattan couple's rise through New York society and the costs of their ambition.

entries.title: The Surrendered
entries.author: Chang-rae Lee
entries.description: A novel spanning decades about three characters whose lives intersect during the Korean War.

entries.title: The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer
entries.author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
entries.description: A comprehensive history of cancer from ancient Egypt to modern targeted therapies.

entries.title: Apollo's Fire: Igniting America's Clean Energy Economy
entries.author: Jay Inslee and Bracken Hendricks
entries.description: A call for America to invest in clean energy technology and green jobs.

entries.title: The Shallows: What the Internet Is Doing to Our Brains
entries.author: Nicholas Carr
entries.description: An examination of how the internet is rewiring our brains and affecting our ability to think deeply.

entries.title: Tinkers
entries.author: Paul Harding
entries.description: A dying man's memories of his father and grandfather in rural New England, a meditation on time and mortality.

entries.title: In Other Rooms, Other Wonders
entries.author: Daniyal Mueenuddin
entries.description: A story collection about social status and expectations within Pakistani culture across different classes.

entries.title: Love in Infant Monkeys
entries.author: Lydia Millet
entries.description: A collection of stories featuring celebrities and the animals that cross their paths.

entries.title: The Dead Hand: The Untold Story of the Cold War Arms Race and Its Dangerous Legacy
entries.author: David E. Hoffman
entries.description: An examination of the Cold War doomsday competition between superpowers and the continued threat of weapons of mass destruction.

entries.title: Half the Sky: Turning Oppression into Opportunity for Women Worldwide
entries.author: Nicholas D. Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn
entries.description: A call to action against gender-based violence and oppression of women in the developing world.

entries.title: The Big Short: Inside the Doomsday Machine
entries.author: Michael Lewis
entries.description: The story of the eccentric traders and investors who foresaw the 2008 financial crisis and bet against the housing market.
